item.title: Rival States, Rival Firms: Competition for World Market Shares
item.description: Strange, Susan, John M. Stopford, with John S. Henley. Rival States, Rival Firms: Competition for World Market Shares. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1991. A self-avowedly part international relations - part international business management work which in keeping with Strange’s views discusses the interdependence between politics and economics without fore-grounding one at the expense of the other. The book builds on Strange’s theory of power and links it through three national studies (Brazil, Malaysia, Kenya) to a consideration of the effect of structural change in the international political economy on the role of TNCs in international economic development.
